relevant_findings.abdominal: Slight epigastric tenderness on palpation without rebound or guarding
relevant_findings.neurological: Decreased sensation of light touch from toes to below knees, absent vibration sensation at toes, decreased at ankles, diminished deep-tendon reflexes at knees and ankles, down-going toes in response to plantar stimulation
Confusion, blurry vision, vertigo; impaired lateral gaze in both eyes, nystagmus on horizontal and upward gaze, positive Romberg test, wide-based unsteady gait

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Sudden worsening of neurological symptoms including ataxia, oculomotor dysfunction, and altered mental status
